title: Drawing, Plate Design:  Les Biscuits [Cookies], for the Service des Objets de Dessert [Service on the Theme of Desserts], 1819–20
title_raw: Plate Design:  Les Biscuits [Cookies], for the Service des Objets de Dessert [Service on the Theme of Desserts]
medium: Pen and brown/brown ink, brush and brown wash, white gouache, graphite on cream laid paper, circular boarder in pen and brown ink
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink, lower center:  Les Biscuits; lower margin, center; upper edge, Mme patissier [underlined]/une mère donne un biscuit a son enfant/encaisse/tandis que la bonne...[unreadable/crossed out]/...du vin/a un autre/pour manger, le sien...un petit gourmand/caché vole des biscuits/a la cuillère. [Mr. Baker/a mother gives a cookie to her child supported /by the good...of the wine who has another one/in order to eat...it herself; a little gourmand/steals lady fingers]; in graphite, right margin center: [unreadable]; upper left margin:  le Madame offre un/biscuit de Savoie [The woman offers a Savoy cookie]; lower right margin: l'autre... [the other ...]
provenance:
Collection H.N.
Spencer Samuels, New York
description: Scene in a pastry shop.  A woman (perhaps shop owner) holding a molded cake, stands to the right of a column with shelves, left middleground, displaying cakes and cookies of many varieties.  A well dressed woman client viewed from behind, center foreground, gives a cookie to a child held by a servant while a boy, right foreround, is preparing to eat a cake resting on a counter.  Another little boy, left foreground, steals a lady finger from a basket on a low table.  The roof of a house and trees appear through the open door, right background.  A graphite sketch of a woman or man holding a fancy cake in lower right margin.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Plate Design:  Les Biscuits [Cookies], for the Service des Objets de Dessert [Service on the Theme of Desserts], 1819–20. Pen and brown/brown ink, brush and brown wash, white gouache, graphite on cream laid paper, circular boarder in pen and brown ink. 
1989-13-23
